summary: This document is a chain of internal emails among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff on July 6-7, 2019, discussing media inquiries and coordination regarding the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails show CNN reaching out for confirmation and the office coordinating on a press release.

persons.name: Berman, Geoffrey
persons.context: Recipient of an email in the chain discussing Epstein's arrest and press strategy.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the email chain; his arrest is being discussed with media outlets like CNN.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney for SDNY, was overseeing the prosecution of Epstein at the time of these emails.

events.title: Media inquiries about Epstein's arrest
events.description: CNN and other media outlets contact the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to confirm the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Internal coordination on press release
events.description: Staff at the U.S. Attorney's Office for SDNY discuss drafting and timing of a press release regarding Epstein's arrest, including checking with the Office of Public Affairs (OPA).

keyFacts: On July 6, 2019, CNN contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to confirm Jeffrey Epstein's arrest.
Internal emails show the office was actively coordinating a press release and media strategy in response to the arrest.
The email chain indicates communication with the Office of Public Affairs (OPA) regarding press obligations.
The document reflects real-time internal government communication about a major case at the moment of Epstein's arrest.
